item.title: Every Playable Character in Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero
item.description:
With 164 playable characters expected at launch, Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero looks set to become the most content-rich Dragon Ball game ever made. This makes sense, really, given that the developers are able to draw from characters from the Dragon Ball Super anime and manga in addition to those introduced throughout all of the Dragon Ball media from the eighties and early nineties.

Granted, Goku and Vegeta make up a significant proportion of the game's playable characters, but there are still plenty of options for those looking to mix things up a little. Dragon Ball Super is particularly well represented, making Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero a great entry point to the Budokai Tenkaichi series for newer fans of the franchise.

Updated July 31, 2024, by Tom Bowen: Roster Update 6 is centered primarily around the Namek saga and introduces fifteen new playable characters to the Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero roster. This includes all of Frieza's Z forms, as well as the remaining members of the Ginyu Force and a few more of Frieza's lackeys. Together, they bring the total number of playable characters in Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero up to 115, meaning that most of the full roster has now been revealed. However, there are still quite a few iconic Dragon Ball characters missing, including a bunch of Cell and Buu forms, so fans of the franchise should keep their eyes peeled for future updates.

item.title: PlayStations Foray Into Mobile Games Presents One Obvious Opportunity
item.description:
Highlights

  • Sony may be entering the mobile game market, and once it does, it would be worth looking into card games inspired by iconic PlayStation franchises like God of War and Uncharted.
  • Mobile card games like Hearthstone and Marvel Snap could be the perfect fit for Sony's extensive library of well-known exclusives.
  • The potential for Sony to revive neglected franchises like Jak and Daxter and Sly Cooper through mobile card games is a promising opportunity for the company. Alternatively, it could bank on active IPs full of lore and characters like God of War.

Aside from a brief stint in mobile gaming with the PSP and the Vita, PlayStation and Sony in general have largely stayed out of the mobile market. But in recent years, mobile games have become one of the major players in the industry, boasting the highest number of players than any other platform out there. But a recent report from the industry indicates that that may no longer be the case. With a burgeoning interest in on-the-go gaming, the mobile market may be seeing an uptick in Sony-owned properties sooner than anyone realizes.

Initial reports are sketchy as to what type of PlayStation titles mobile fans can expect to hit app stores, but Sonys probably taking some inspiration from other major developers that have done the same. Theres one genre of game in particular that would fit like a glove for Sony and its many iconic properties, including some of the more neglected franchises like Jak and Daxter , inFamous, and Sly Cooper : card games.

Sony Should Look Into a Hearthstone or Marvel Snap Style Card Game

Card games like Hearthstone and Marvel Snap would be a perfect fit for Sonys big debut into the mobile game market. Card games like that are hugely successful and make excellent use of a companys extended IP library. Short of Nintendo, Sony probably has the most iconic list of franchises in the industry, all of which would feel right at home appearing in a PlayStation-tinged version of some of the most popular mobile game genres on the market.

There are two main avenues Sony can take if its actually pursuing a mobile card game; Hearthstone or Marvel Snap . Marvel Snap is a more straightforward card game featuring beloved characters and iconography from the Marvel Universe. Hearthstone , on the other hand, is supposed to be representative of an in-universe game, taking place within World of Warcraft featuring in-world lore, locations, spells, and the like.

How Sony Can Learn From Hearthstone and Marvel Snap

More than any other franchise, God of War would be a perfect fit for a Hearthstone -inspired Sony game. The most recent two games alone are rich enough to fill out an entire game, and thats not even counting the original God of War trilogy. Mythology in general serves as an excellent inspiration for any game, and God of War has been so keen about leaning into and embracing its Norse and Greek roots that blending it into a card game seems like it would just be a logical next step.

The other route Sony can take with its jump into the mobile market is to model its first title after Marvel Snap and make a general purpose card game not tied to any one universes lore or internal consistency. Marvel Snap is a lot more akin to something like the Pokemon or Yu-gi-oh card games, just slotting in monsters for various iconic Marvel properties. Sony has a surplus of mascots and well-known exclusives that would be shoo-ins for some representation in a title like this, especially where many of its franchises have been going through content droughts. Appearances in a card game could be what those long-dormant franchises need to get back up off the ground.

Playstation Franchises that Can Feature in a Sony Mobile Card Game

  • God of War
  • Last of Us
  • Uncharted
  • inFamous
  • Killzone
  • Twisted Metal
  • Jak and Daxter
  • Resistance
  • Marvel's Spider-Man
  • Sly Cooper

Theres no telling exactly what PlayStation will do with its first mobile game. Its clearly been cooking for a while after Sony forged a new partnership with a mobile game studio back in 2023; the first Sony mobile game may be in production already and closer to release than anyone actually realizes. Sony may even surprise everyone by making something absolutely no one expected, like a gacha game. Still, it would absolutely be leaving a lot of money on the table by not adopting the card game model laid out by other industry front-runners.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Chart Shows Stellar Jade Count for Version 2.5
item.description:
Highlights

  • A new Honkai: Star Rail chart shows off the sizable quantity of Stellar Jades players will be able to earn throughout the Version 2.5 update.
  • Honkai: Star Rail's new events and repeatable content will offer players thousands of Stellar Jades, with up to 10,735 Jades available for free-to-play players.
  • Players are being given plenty of opportunities to spend their Stellar Jades, with Jiaoqiu and Yunli as new five-star characters in Version 2.5 and Feixiao, Lingsha, and Moze coming in Version 2.5.

A helpful Honkai: Star Rail infographic details the total number of Stellar Jades players will be able to earn throughout the duration of the Version 2.5 update. The popular sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse officially launched its newest version earlier today, debuting a plethora of new content to the game with its debut. Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 2.5 brings plenty to the RPG, including three brand-new playable characters and a new map in the Xianzhou Luofu. Now, players are getting a better idea of all the different ways to earn Stellar Jades throughout the update.

Honkai: Star Rail offers a variety of different methods for players to earn Stellar Jades within the games, both available from repeatable content and limited-time events. Each new update typically brings a slew of events to the game, with one main event providing a significant quantity of gacha currency for players. The game's permanent content also typically sees multiple updates during each patch, with game modes like the Simulated Universe and Pure Fiction offering more rewards. Version 2.5 looks like it's jam-packed with Stellar Jades for players ready to grind.

A chart created for Honkai: Star Rail by community member nivskis shows off the multitude of ways to earn Stellar Jades throughout Version 2.5. The update's new events serve as some of the update's main attractions, with the "Luminary Wardance" event offering 1,200 Stellar Jades and "Festive Revelry" granting 540 Jades. The game's regular content will also offer a significant sum of Jades for dedicated players, with daily missions giving out up to 2,520 Stellar Jades. The chart also breaks down the total earnings for free-to-play users, with 10,735 Stellar Jades and 15 Star Rail Passes available.

Honkai: Star Rail Chart Shows Version 2.5 Stellar Jade Count

  • Daily Training : 2520 Stellar Jades
  • Gift of Odyssey : 10 Star Rail Special Passes
  • October Shop Reset : 5 Star Rail Special Passes, 5 Star Rail Passes
  • Maintenance: 600 Stellar Jades
  • Weekly Simulated Universe Reset : 1,350 Stellar Jades, 6 Star Rail Passes
  • Divergent Universe : 480 Stellar Jades
  • Missions : 600 Stellar Jades
  • Characters Showcase : 80 Stellar Jades
  • Version 2.5 Special Program : 300 Stellar Jades
  • New Location : 300 Stellar Jades
  • New Achievements : 245 Stellar Jades
  • Redemption Codes : 120 Stellar Jades
  • Nameless Glory : 5 Star Rail Passes
  • Luminary Wardance : 1200 Stellar Jades
  • Festive Revelry : 540 Stellar Jades
  • Memory of Chaos , Pure Fiction, Apocalyptic Shadow : 2,400 Stellar Jades

The wealth of Stellar Jades within Version 2.5 will look to help players pick up a wide array of highly-anticipated Honkai: Star Rail characters. Version 2.5 debuted with new character Yunli as the newest featured five-star character, alongside a re-run for Huohuo. The second half will add Jiaoqiu and a re-run of Sparkle as its spotlight characters during the patch. Yunli and Huohuo are available now through Honkai: Star Rail 's limited gacha banner, while Jiaoqiu and Sparkle are expected to appear on August 21.

With the launch of Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 2.5, HoYoverse has already begun to tease players with the spotlight characters from the next update. Version 2.5 will feature a pair of new five-star characters, with Feixiao and Lingsha confirmed as the next five-star units to join the game. Moze will also be added to the game during the Version 2.5 update as a four-star character, with no confirmation about whether he will run alongside Feixiao or Lingsha. Star Rail fans should look to take advantage of Version 2.5's plethora of Stellar Jades for all of its upcoming characters.

item.title: PlayStation VR2 Sales Are Reportedly Enjoying a Massive Spike
item.description:
Highlights

  • Huge price drop causes PlayStation VR2 sales spike, sold out on Amazon.
  • Early struggles due to high price and lack of games are being overcome.
  • PlayStation VR2 to gain new life with PC gaming compatibility and price drop.

Sony's PlayStation VR2 has experienced a massive surge in sales after a huge price drop was offered. The PlayStation VR2 has sold out on Amazon and has seen more sales in the past week than in the first seven months of 2024.

The PlayStation VR2 was initially released in early 2023 to an unsubstantial response. A PSVR 2 requires a PlayStation 5 to run, meaning that the high price, lack of games, and slow-growing nature of the VR market resulted in the PlayStation VR2 underperforming upon launch. With VR being a niche market, the PSVR 2 was left awkwardly behind. Many critics at the time were saying that the high price of entry for the PSVR 2 was the biggest factor in turning fans away from the console, and that a price drop could be what was needed to save it.

As reported by The Shortcut, the PlayStation VR2 has seen a 2350% increase in sales over the past weekend. What brought so much attention to the PSVR 2 is a recent sale that took a massive slash out of the price tag. Game, Amazon, Smyths Toys, and other major retailers were reported to be offering massive discounts on the PlayStation VR2. The PS VR2 was originally priced at $550, but some retailers were offering it for a reduced price of $350, bringing the headset to the cheapest price it has been seen at since launch. This discount has resulted in the PlayStation VR2 selling out on Amazon, as what was previously considered an unaffordable luxury has become something that exceeded the expectations of suppliers, as fans have rushed out to grab the VR set while the bargain lasts.

PlayStation VR2 Sales Have Increased By 2350% Thanks to Massive Sale

A big drawback for many fans when it came to the PlayStation VR2 was that it only works with the PlayStation 5, requiring gamers to own both consoles to get use out of the VR. That is soon to change, thanks to Sony's plans to allow PSVR 2 users to play PC games using the device. A recent announcement confirmed a collaboration with Steam for an app that will allow players to play their Steam games through the PlayStation VR2, massively increasing the availability of the PlayStation VR2, and solving two of the biggest issues that the console had; available games and limited use.

Recent rumors that Sony has halted production on the PlayStation VR2 may not be as true as first thought, as the PlayStation VR2 gains a new burst of life thanks to a huge drop in price and new features to allow gamers to enter the world of VR from their computers as well as the PS5.

item.title: Sons Of The Forest: Best Weapons (And Where To Find Them)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Crafted Spear
  • Crafted Club
  • Crafted Bow
  • Axe
  • Cattle Prod/Stun Baton
  • Machete
  • Katana
  • Chainsaw
  • Guitar
  • Putter
  • Pickaxe
  • Modern Axe
  • Firefighter Axe
  • Compound Bow
  • Crossbow
  • Stun Gun
  • Pistol
  • Revolver
  • Molotov
  • Frag Grenade
  • Shotgun
  • Rifle

Highlights

  • Sons of The Forest introduces a new protagonist and plot with a high-tech rescue operative role and more weapons.
  • Crafting weapons is essential for stealth and combat. Crafted spears, clubs, and bows are ideal early-game tools.
  • Various weapons, from basic axes to chainsaws, cater to different playstyles in the game's cannibal-infested island setting.

The new release of Sons Of The Forest has players returning to a cannibal-infested island in a bid to survive and thrive. One key change from its predecessor is the protagonist and the overall plot. Rather than being a civilian passenger in a plane crash, the player will embrace the role of a high-tech rescue operative, meaning more tricks, tools, and weapons are available. Including firearms is also a welcome change, along with companions and a series of other technical improvements. A series of new melee weapons have also been added to the game, along with the return of a few fan favorites from the first game. The forest can be thick and difficult to navigate, so with each weapon, a short guide on where and how to find them is included.

While it is largely down to each player and their preferences which weapon they prefer, there are certainly some weapons that have considerable advantages over others, and sometimes they are not altogether as difficult to acquire as they might seem. Players can collect and craft a range of weapons and store them all in a single inventory, so there is no need to worry about having to ditch one weapon in favor of another one.

Updated July 31, 2024 by Andrew McLarney: With the release of the 1.0 update, Sons of the Forest has officially left Early Access, with a number of new features, weapons, traps and events now introduced to the game. New weapons have been added, as well as existing entries being re-ordered and amended in accordance with the game as it evolves.

Crafted Spear

Though Easy To Craft, This Weapon Is Best Used For Hunting

  • Crafting Ingredients: 2x Stick, 1x Utility Knife, 1x Tape

Crafting is one of the core features for players to familiarize themselves with in Sons of the Forest. A good way to do this is through the crafting of basic weapons. The spear is a useful tool that can either be thrust or thrown at any desired target.

The ingredients are relatively common and should be easy to find in abandoned camps or cave entrances. Unfortunately, the weapon is relatively weak without upgrades. It is best used for hunting fish and deer, rather than standing up to cannibal tribes.

Crafted Club

A Brute Force Blunt Weapon For When Things Get Tribal

  • Crafting Ingredients: 1x Stick, 1x Rope, 1x Skull

Much like the Crafted Spear, the Crafted Club is a relatively primitive weapon. Without upgrades, it will be less effective than even the basic axe. While the damage output may be slightly higher, it comes at the cost of a very slow swing speed.

Fortunately, this can be improved with the addition of Solafite, a unique resource found throughout the island, particularly in caves. Applying the upgrade will give a damage boost to the club, making it significantly more powerful.

Crafted Bow

A Versatile Ranged Weapon, Though A Basic One

  • Crafting Ingredients: 2x Stick, 2x Rope, 2x Tape

The Crafted Bow is easily one of the best early-game tools players can craft. It will enable them to both hunt and fight from a distance, all while remaining relatively stealthy. It will also have near-limitless ammunition in the form of sticks and stones.

While it may not be as powerful as some of the other bows and ranged weapons in the game, the Crafted Bow is bound to be useful for players in the early stages of a game. It can always be a good backup, considering that firearms ammunition is not easy to come by.

Axe

The Basic Starting Tool For All Players

  • Location: Automatically acquired during cutscene

This small axe is provided in the emergency pack that the player will automatically pick up during the game's opening crash cutscene(s). This versatile weapon can be used to hack down trees, ropes, and enemies alike.

It is very light and fast to use, which allows the player to deliver many hits in a short space of time without having to worry about long wind-ups. The downside is a weak block that will not do much to stop larger cannibal attacks.

Cattle Prod/Stun Baton

Can Temporarily Slow Enemies and Reduce Cannibal Aggression

  • Location: Cave entrance near the southern lake

The cattle prod is a stun weapon that can be used to pacify enemies at close range. Depending on the relationship the player wants with the cannibal tribes, stunning enemies can be better than butchering them in front of their friends, making the cattle prod a useful tool in any Sons of the Forest player's inventory.

The cattle prod/stun baton can be found in a pile of skulls near a cave by the lake that is connected to the sea. Players can follow the rivers from the sea to locate it, and will not need a shovel to retrieve it, as with some others.

Machete

A Fast, Effective Blade Ideal For Dicing Up Enemies

  • Location: Southern Bay Camp

The machete is a brutal weapon and can be used for crafting or combat alike. A swift cutting arc makes this weapon one of the best choices in Sons of the Forest . The machete can be found in a small ruined camp on a beach in the southern bay, opposite the cave entrance and sea helicopter crash site.

This should be relatively easy to find for players who crash-land nearby. For others who may have had alternate beginnings, it's best to look for the small estuary in the south of the island to locate the cave entrance.

Katana

Perfect For Dismembering Enemies Quickly

  • Location: Underground Bunker (North)

As the best weapon from The Forest , the katana is difficult to access. The katana is a very fast blade that will cut through most cannibals with ease, and cause massive damage. Be prepared to fight if searching for this one, as it is located deep inside a well-defended location hidden in a cave on the northern side of the island, just above the lake.

Though acquiring this weapon may prove difficult, it is worth the effort since it is one of the best melee weapons in the game. In addition, underground bunkers often house a variety of other useful tools and items, so it's worth taking the time to look for them.

Chainsaw

For When Maximum Carnage Is Required

  • Location: Underground Bunker Cinema Room

The chainsaw is located in the same underground facility as the katana, only this time it is in a sort of theater room. This room is located to the right, toward the exit of the swimming pool. This highly effective weapon can dismember enemies of all sizes and create a gory mess. It is also an efficient tree-cutter, which will be essential when building a large base.

The chainsaw requires batteries to operate, and these will need to be topped up over time. It can also be an extremely efficient tool for cutting down trees, but we know that's not what most players will use it for.

Guitar

An Inferior Wooden Weapon With A Dual Purpose

  • Location: Entertainment Bunker

The guitar is more of a novelty item than a first-choice weapon, but it still provides great entertainment when being used to batter lower-level enemies around. It can also be used to play instrumental covers of the game's soundtrack, so it is worth retrieving for that alone.

The guitar can be found in the Entertainment Bunker along with the Modern Axe and Electric Chainsaw. It should go without saying both these alternatives are preferable to the guitar when it comes to combating mutants.

Putter

A Blunt Club With A Fast Swing Speed And Unique Ability

  • Location: North-East Golf Course

The Putter is another novelty weapon that can be used for entertainment. In addition to clubbing tribal cannibals over the head, it can also be used in conjunction with any collected golf balls to tee off just about anywhere on the map.

There are several places in which players can acquire a Putter, but the most reliable is the golf course in the northeastern region of the map. Here, a club can usually be found next to the abandoned cart, and another in the sand trap.

Pickaxe

A Brutal Stabbing Weapon With Good Melee Range

  • Location: Solafite Cave (North-East)

Though perhaps not the ideal weapon, the Pickaxe has several uses beyond impaling cannibals and mutants. It can also be used in conjunction with the Solafite Upgrader to produce unique items, and the axe itself can also be upgraded with solafite.

The Pickaxe has a surprisingly nifty swing speed, and its thrusting damage is likely to cause enemies to stagger when hit cleanly. While the Pickaxe is a decent weapon, especially for the early game, it may struggle against some of the game's larger enemies.

Modern Axe

Great For Lopping Down Trees And Mutants Alike

  • Location: North-Eastern purple GPS marker

The Modern Axe strikes an ideal balance between speed and power. While the weapon can deal a deadly blow, taking down even larger cannibals with just a few swings, it also has the speed to deliver these attacks quickly without offering enemies a chance to recover and counter.

The only downside is the cost of stamina, which can deplete very quickly when swinging together combos with the axe. In almost every way, this is an upgraded version of the standard axe and can be put to use in crafting as well as combat.

Firefighter Axe

A Hard-Hitting But Slow-Swinging Axe With Extra Stun Damage

  • Location: Maintenance A Bunker (North-West)

The Firefighter Axe is a powerful two-handed weapon, capable of delivering even more damage than the modern axe, though at the cost of a slower swing. Power attacks with this axe are more likely to cause staggering to enemies than most other melee weapons.

To find the Firefighter Axe, players will need to head to Maintenance Bunker A in the northwest of the map. Like the other maintenance bunker entrances, this will require a shovel to excavate. Once inside, the axe can be found in an emergency box next to the generator.

Compound Bow

A Powerful Modern Bow With Great Accuracy And Velocity

  • Location: Maintenance Bunker B (South-West)

The compound bow is arguably the best in the game due to its strong power, range, and accuracy. While it doesn't possess a sight, it is still quite straightforward to aim and can make a worthy upgrade from the Crafted Bow.

To find the Compound Bow, players will need to locate Maintenance Bunker B in the southwest area of the island. The entrance will require a shovel to uncover, and once inside, the bow can be found next to a body in a bathtub there.

Crossbow

Can Turn Players From Prey Into Predator

  • Location: Underground Bunker

The crossbow is one of the most powerful ranged weapons in the game and offers the additional advantage of stealth when attacking cannibals. Once the 3D printer room has been found and a maintenance key card acquired in the underground bunker, players can access a green room with plants inside.

Passing through here and into the next room, players will find the crossbow in between bookshelves and next to a dead body in the darkness. The weapon relies on a rare type of ammunition called crossbow bolts, which can be its only downside.

Stun Gun

Useful For Pacifying Enemies, But Difficult To Retrieve

  • Location: Deep inside the Southern Cave

Like the cattle prod, the stun gun can be useful for tranquilizing rather than killing enemies, offering a ranged alternative that can be especially valuable in low-health situations. The stun gun is deep inside the first cave encountered from the sea crash site, which is located on the northern side of the same bay as the machete.

The gun is found on the body of a dead maintenance worker, who has been strung up by the neck from the ceiling of the cave. Players can choose to either exit via the way they came or delve deeper into the caverns to search for more valuables.

Pistol

Kill Many Enemies With A Single Headshot

  • Location: In a small life raft in the Southern Bay

The pistol can be located by following the markers on the protagonist's GPS tracker. Head to the point closest to the ocean, and there will be an orange life raft visible at sea. Climb aboard the life raft to find valuable supplies. including the pistol. This weapon will cut down cannibals with ease, but its loud noise is likely to attract more of them, so it is best to use it only in emergencies.

The player can also give the weapon to Virginia, who has formidable accuracy when doing so. This can be one of the best uses of the pistol, as it will enable players to maximize the overall defensive capabilities of their camp, provided they have befriended Virginia.

Revolver

A Devastating Pistol With Limited Ammunition

  • Location: Green marker in the northeast

The Revolver is a powerful six-shot pistol, capable of taking down even the larger cannibals and mutants in the game with just a few well-placed hits. It is more powerful than the regular pistol, but the trade-off is its limited ammo capacity.

To find the revolver, head to the northeast area of the island and look for the green marker. It will first be necessary to acquire a shovel since some digging will be required to access the underground shelter where the revolver is hidden. A full guide on how to obtain the revolver can be found here.

Molotov

Ideal For Groups Of Enemies Or Larger Mutants

  • Crafting Ingredients: 1x Cloth, 1x Vodka Bottle

Molotovs are incredibly useful grenade-like weapons that can cause devastating fire damage to large groups of enemies. Unlike many of the other weapons in Sons of the Forest , Molotovs do not have to be found and can be crafted using relatively common items found throughout the game world.

These can be acquired in various places around the island, but typically camps and boxes are the best places to look. Camps are also often identified by red flares which billow red smoke into the sky. These locations are ideal for finding these ingredients and many others.

Frag Grenade

A Powerful Explosive Weapon

One of the more powerful military-grade weapons players can find in Sons of the Forest is the frag grenade. Ideal when faced with groups of enemies or larger mutants, the frag grenade can send limbs flying and strike fear into onlooking cannibals as their fellow tribesmen get blown apart.

These grenades can be found in camps marked with a red flare, often in explosives cases, along with dynamite or useful crafting ingredients.

Shotgun

Hugely Damaging In Close Quarters

  • Location: South-Western GPS marker

The shotgun is one of the most effective ranged weapons in Sons Of The Forest , dealing huge amounts of damage, particularly at close range. The shotgun is located at a grave on the southwestern side of the map. The grave will be marked with red cloth, but keep in mind that it will first be necessary to acquire the shovel to dig it up.

The shovel can be found in the underground cave system, along with the Rope Gun and Rebreather tools. Shotgun shells can most often be found in underground facilities or abandoned military encampments.

Rifle

A Sighted Rifle Offering Range, Accuracy, and Power

  • Location: Cultist Cave Eastern Entrance

This bolt-action Rifle is one of the best weapons players can hope to find in Sons of the Forest , offering a great balance between power, range, and accuracy. The Rifle is the ideal tool for base defense and keeping watch at longer distances.

While the ammo is scarce, players will be able to find small amounts of it by exploring the underground facility and other military-related locations. While it may not be outright the strongest weapon in terms of damage, speed, or maneuverability, the Rifle is sure to make every FPS player feel right at home, even in such an inhospitable environment as a cannibal-infested forest on a remote island.
